lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/duke/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `run Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:
Done loading past record onto your task list!
Updating task status based on past record
Done updating! Please type "List" to check!
## Running jar file on Command Prompt
If you are running the jar file on Command Prompt, please use the following command:
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* Decodes user input and execute the program accordingly.
* 1. list - prints all tasks in the task list.
* 2. done - sets the status of the desired task as done.
* 3. delete - deletes a desired task based on task index.
* 4. todo - adds a new ToDo task.
* 5. event - adds a new Event task.
* 6. deadline - adds a new Deadline task.
* 7. find - prints all tasks containing the given find key word.
* 8. save - saves all tasks available to Duke_output.txt.
* 9. bye - exits the program and saves all tasks available to Duke_output.txt.
* Program is always running until user inputs "bye".
* p.s all other inputs will be ignored!
* @param taskList Task list which stores different types of tasks.
* @throws IOException If the Storage class fails to read / write data.
private static void decodingUserCommands(TaskList taskList) throws IOException {
* Storage class which deals with data loading and data saving.
* Loads data from Duke_output.txt for past record tasks.
* @param taskList Task list which stores different types of tasks.
} else if (content.startsWith(DEADLINE_TASK_TYPE)) { //pastRecord has a deadline task and add the deadline to the task list

* @param taskList Task list which stores different types of tasks.
* @throws IOException If failed to write the file.
public static void saveData(TaskList taskList) throws IOException {
System.out.println("file close without saving as there is nothing to save!");
* Returns the index of the ending of the task description.
* @return taskDescriptionEndIndex Index of the ending of the task description.
public abstract class DukeExceptions extends Exception {
System.out.println ("\u2639 " + "OOPS!!! The task description cannot be empty.");
System.out.println ("\u2639 " + "OOPS!!! The time description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
System.out.println ("\u2639 " + "OOPS!!! The time description of an event cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("\u2639 " + "OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Messages class which deals with user interaction.
/** Prints a dotted line to separate the content. */
/** Prints a good bye message to the user. */
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
/** Prints a greeting message to the user. */
/** Prints a message to inform the user that the past record has been loaded. */
System.out.println("Done loading past record onto your task list!\n"
+ "Updating task status based on past record\n"
/** Prints a data loading message to the user. */
/** Prints a welcome message to the user. */
/** Prints all available commands to the user. */
+ "p.s all other inputs will be ignored!\n"
* Prints a task done message to the user.
* @param task Task which to be marked done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n"
* Prints all stored tasks in the task list.
* @param taskList TaskList which contains all stored tasks.
* Prints all stored tasks which contain the key word.
* @param taskList TaskList which contains all stored tasks.
* @param keyword User defined key word which is to be searched through all tasks.
public static void printFoundTasks(TaskList taskList, String keyword) {
System.out.println("Searching for matching tasks in your list\n");
System.out.println(SAD_FACE_EMOJI + "There is no matching task with" + keyword);
/** Prints an error message when user input empty ToDo task. */
System.out.println(SAD_FACE_EMOJI + "OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
/** Prints an error message when user input empty Event task. */
System.out.println(SAD_FACE_EMOJI + "OOPS!!! The description / date of an event cannot be empty.");
/** Prints an error message when user input empty Deadline task. */
System.out.println(SAD_FACE_EMOJI + "OOPS!!! The description / date of a deadline cannot be empty.");
/** Prints an error message when user did not input task number to be deleted. */
System.out.println(SAD_FACE_EMOJI  + "OOPS!!! The task number to be deleted cannot be empty.");
/** Prints an error message when user did not input task number to be marked as done. */
System.out.println(SAD_FACE_EMOJI  + "OOPS!!! The task number to be done cannot be empty.");
/** Prints an error message when user did not input find key word. */
System.out.println(SAD_FACE_EMOJI + "OOPS!!! The find keyword cannot be empty.");
* Prints a message to indicate a task is added successfully.
* @param taskList TaskList which contains all stored tasks.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a message to indicate a task is added successfully.
* @param taskList TaskList which contains all stored tasks.
* @param taskNumberToDelete Index of task to be deleted.
public static void printTaskDeletedMessage(TaskList taskList, int taskNumberToDelete) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.getSize() + " tasks in the list. and deletion happened");
* Prints an error message when the index of task to be deleted
* or marked as done is larger than the size of the list.
System.out.println("The task number is out of bound! Please type \"list\"");
* Prints an error message when the user input is different from the available commands.
System.out.println(SAD_FACE_EMOJI + "OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
/** Prints a message to indicate that there is no task in the list. */
/** Prints a message to indicate that the task to be marked as done is already done. */
System.out.println("Chill man, this task is completed!");
/** Prints an error message when user input is not following the correct command format. */
System.out.println(SAD_FACE_EMOJI + "OOPS!!! Wrong input format. Please type help to see command examples");
/** Prints a message when Duke_output.txt has no content. */
System.out.println("There is no past record! You are a 1st time user");
* Deadline class represents a deadline task which consists of
* a task description, task date and a task status.
* Creates an Deadline task with the given task description and given task date,
* and sets the task status to default: false / not done.
* @param description Description of the deadline being created.
* Returns the description of the deadline.
* Returns the description of the event.
* @return D Default task type for deadline.
* Saves the task in a pre-determined format when writing to a file.
* @return the required format when writing to a file
* Event class represents an event task which consists of
* a task description, task date and a task status.
* Creates an Event task with the given task description and given task date,
* and sets the task status to default: false / not done.
* @param description Description of the event being created.
* Returns the description of the event.
* Returns the description of the event.
* @return E Default task type for event.
* Saves the task in a pre-determined format when writing to a file.
* @return the required format when writing to a file
* Parser class which helps to decode and execute the user command.
* Parsers the user input and execute the program accordingly.
* - prints an empty list message if there is no task available,
* - else program prints all tasks available in the task list.
* - tasks available are saved to "Duke_output.txt" and prints bye message.
* - prints empty todo error message if no task description,
* - else program adds a new ToDo task and print task added message.
* - prints empty event error message if no task description or no task date,
* - else program adds a new Event task and print task added message.
* - prints empty deadline error message if no task description or no task date,
* - else program adds a new Deadline task and print task added message.
* - prints empty delete error message if no task index,
* - or prints empty list message if there is no task available for deletion,
* - or prints index out of bound message if the given index is larger than the task list size,
* - else program removes the task at the given index and print task deleted message.
* - prints empty done error message if no task index,
* - or prints empty list message if there is no task available to be marked as done,
* - or prints task already done message if the task at the given index is already done,
* - or prints index out of bound message if the given index is larger than the task list size,
* - else program marks the task at the given index as done and print task done message.
* - prints an empty find message if there is no find keyword,
* - or prints a message to indicate no matching task,
* - else program prints all tasks containing the keyword.
* - prints all available commands for the program.
* - tasks available are saved to "Duke_output.txt" and prints file saved message.
* All other inputs are treated as invalid input and program prints invalid input error message.
* @param userInput Input commands from the user.
* @param taskList TaskList which is used to store a list of tasks.
public static void parser(String userInput, TaskList taskList) {
* Returns the corrected task date from the user input.
* @param input User input for the program.
* @return correctedTaskDate Task date which is used for creation of event or deadline task.
* Returns a task index which will be used for task deletion or marking the task done.
* @param input User input for the program.
* @return index Task index which is used for task deletion or marking done.
convertedInput = input.replaceAll("[^0-9]", "");//replace all non-number with space
* Returns the status of the program.
* The program will keep taking user input unless COMMAND_BYE is detected.
* @return isRun Status tracker for the program.
* Task class represents a task which consists of a task description
* Creates a Task with the given task description
* and sets the task status to default: false / not done.
* @param description Description of the task being created.
* @return isDone Tick symbol when isDone is true and cross symbol when isDone is false.
return (isDone ? STATUS_DONE : STATUS_UNDONE); //return tick or cross symbols
* Will be overridden by different task type.
* Returns T is task is todo type.
* Returns E if task is event type.
* Returns D if task is deadline type.
* @return T Default task type for task.
* Returns the task status as done.
* @return isDone Task status is updated to done.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Saves the task in a pre-determined format when writing to a file.
* Will be overridden by the type of tasks.
* TaskList class represents a list of tasks.
* Creates a taskList consists of an array of Task.
* Adds a given type of task to the task list.
* @param t Any type of above-mentioned task.
* Removes a specific task from the task list.
* @param index Index of the task to be removed.
* Marks a specific task from the task list as done.
* @param index Index of the task to be marked as done.
* Returns the total number of tasks available in the task list.
* @return number of tasks in the task list.
* Returns a specific task from the task list as done.
* @param index Index of the task to be returned.
* @return the task at the given index.
* ToDo class represents a todo task which consists of
* a task description and a task status.
* Creates a ToDo task with the given task description
* and sets the task status to default: false / not done.
* @param description Description of the task being created.
* Saves the task in a pre-determined format when writing to a file.
* @return the required format when writing to a file
